result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Calendar call on February 22, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Activity: Preliminary hearing and Arraignment
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

9:24 AM Defendant Arik Daniel Givhan appeared by video.  Attorney Walter H Isaacson appeared by video for Arik Daniel Givhan.  Attorney Mary Elizabeth Bricco appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant's attorney, reading waived. Defendant's attorney pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set. Bond to continue.
Preliminary hearing on October 25, 2022 at 09:15 am.

9:30 AM Defendant Arik Daniel Givhan in court.  Attorney Walter H Isaacson in court for Arik Daniel Givhan.  Prosecuting attorney Alexander David Goulart in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant requests preliminary hearing by zoom. Time limits waived.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Indigency hearing on September 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

3:47 PM Defendant Arik Daniel Givhan appeared by video, in custody from the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Ryan W O'Hara appeared by video for Arik Daniel Givhan.  Prosecuting attorney David S Olson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Matter to be set for appointment of Attorney. Bond continued.

Activity: Return on warrant/Initial appearance 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

3:17 PM Defendant Arik Daniel Givhan appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Gerald Anthony Urbik appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address updated. Court recalls warrant. Cash bond set of $250.00 with conditions. Defendant to contact public defenders office. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 3PM.
